title: Kendrick Lamar in crown of thorns abortion protest
description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning rapper closes his headline set at the festival with a powerful statement.

title: Ukraine war: BBC journalist Olga Malchevska returns to bombed Kyiv home
description: Olga Malchevska was live on air when she saw images of her childhood home in the aftermath of a Russian attack.

title: Roe v Wade: Church that helped Jane Roe still aids abortion-seekers
description: This church helped the original Roe - and will keep aiding abortion-seekers after Supreme Court ruling.

title: Forced to Beg: Tanzania’s Trafficked Kids
description: A BBC undercover investigation has exposed a human trafficking network smuggling disabled children from Tanzania to Kenya.

title: Kenyan policeman's suicide: A widow's grief
description: The force takes on mental health to help officers affected by stress - but for some it comes too late.

title: Sharing shopping hacks for those with dwarfism
description: Cait wants to help others who who have dwarfism and struggle to shop on the high street.

title: Ukraine war: What Severodonetsk's fall means for the conflict
description: Russian troops must still cross the Siversky Donets river to capture all of the Luhansk region.

title: In pictures: Glastonbury 2022
description: Thousands of people are attending the event which has returned for the first time in three years.

title: At least 20 found dead in South Africa nightclub
description: Post-mortem examinations will be carried out shortly to determine the cause of mysterious deaths.

title: Johnson will lead Tories at next election, says Brandon Lewis
description: Brandon Lewis says the PM has the drive and enthusiasm to go on, despite growing criticism.

title: Patrick Grady to step away from SNP membership over allegations
description: The Glasgow North MP is reportedly under police investigation over allegations of sexual harassment.

title: Roe v Wade: 'Feels like we're going backwards,' says Coco Gauff
description: Coco Gauff says she feels like "we're almost going backwards" after the US Supreme Court's decision to remove the constitutional right to abortion.

title: Andy Murray 'grateful' to be reunited with Ivan Lendl for Wimbledon
description: Andy Murray says he was turned down by a "lot of coaches" before reuniting for a third spell with Ivan Lendl in March.

title: Ukraine war: Helping families find missing loved ones
description: A Red Cross call centre is reuniting Ukrainian and Russian prisoners of war with their loved ones.

title: Ukraine war: Keep up unity amid war fatigue, says PM
description: Boris Johnson says the higher food and energy costs from the conflict are the price of freedom.

title: Crowland WWII Buffalo LVT on show after restoration
description: The landing craft had lain buried for 74 years before it was unearthed by volunteers.

title: England v New Zealand: Ben Foakes out of third Test after testing positive for Covid-19
description: England wicketkeeper Ben Foakes is ruled out of the remainder of the third Test against New Zealand after testing positive for Covid-19.

title: Bexleyheath sinkhole to take up to six weeks to repair
description: The road's collapse caused "extensive damage" to services, including sewers, officials say.

title: How a family of 14 is coping with rising costs
description: Mother of 12, Zoe Sullivan, explains how she cuts costs as her family's energy and fuel bills double.

title: Ukraine war: UK joins ban on imports of Russian gold
description: The move by the UK, US, Canada and Japan will "strike at the heart of Putin's war machine", the UK PM says.

title: Euro 2022: Iceland's Sara Bjork Gunnarsdottir on being a mother and professional footballer
description: With football-playing mothers figuring in this summer's Euros like never before, two of Iceland's best tell BBC Sport about their journey to the tournament.

title: Prince Charles 'accepted a suitcase with 1m euros', report claims
description: Clarence House says the correct processes were followed with the Qatari sheikh's charitable donations.

title: Cycling: TfL to begin issuing fines to drivers in cycle lanes
description: New powers will allow TfL to enforce infringements in a similar way to bus lanes.

title: Emma Raducanu at Wimbledon: There will be 'huge expectation' but 'let's give her time'
description: How will Emma Raducanu handle her first Wimbledon as a Grand Slam champion - and might we all be expecting too much?

title: The Papers: 'Crackdown on unions' and PM plans for third term
description: The papers lead with strike action warnings and Tory MPs slam Boris Johnson's "delusional" behaviour.

title: Drivers who kill could receive life sentences under law reform
description: Judges will be able to give life sentences to dangerous drivers who kill, in a toughening of the law.

title: Dave Grohl and Bruce Springsteen join Paul McCartney at Glastonbury
description: It is the star's first public appearance since the death of Foo Fighters' drummer Taylor Hawkins.
